element.name: Segment
element.documentation: The Root Element that contains all other Top-Level Elements (Elements defined only at Level 1). A Matroska file is composed of 1 Segment.

element.name: SeekHead
element.documentation: Contains the Segment Position of other Top-Level Elements.

element.name: Seek
element.documentation: Contains a single seek entry to an EBML Element.

element.name: SeekID
element.documentation: The binary ID corresponding to the Element name.

element.name: SeekPosition
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Element.

element.name: Info
element.documentation: Contains general information about the Segment.

element.name: TimestampScale
element.documentation: Timestamp scale in nanoseconds (1.000.000 means all timestamps in the Segment are expressed in milliseconds).

element.name: Duration
element.documentation: Duration of the Segment in nanoseconds based on TimestampScale.

element.name: DateUTC
element.documentation: The date and time that the Segment was created by the muxing application or library.

element.name: Title
element.documentation: General name of the Segment.

element.name: MuxingApp
element.documentation: Muxing application or library (example: "libmatroska-0.4.3").
Include the full name of the application or library followed by the version number.

element.name: WritingApp
element.documentation: Writing application (example: "mkvmerge-0.3.3").
Include the full name of the application followed by the version number.

element.name: Cluster
element.documentation: The Top-Level Element containing the (monolithic) Block structure.

element.name: Timestamp
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp of the cluster (based on TimestampScale).

element.name: PrevSize
element.documentation: Size of the previous Cluster, in octets. Can be useful for backward playing.

element.name: SimpleBlock
element.documentation: Similar to Block but without all the extra information, mostly used to reduced overhead when no extra feature is needed. (see SimpleBlock Structure)

element.name: BlockGroup
element.documentation: Basic container of information containing a single Block and information specific to that Block.

element.name: Block
element.documentation: Block containing the actual data to be rendered and a timestamp relative to the Cluster Timestamp. (see Block Structure)

element.name: BlockAdditions
element.documentation: Contain additional blocks to complete the main one. An EBML parser that has no knowledge of the Block structure could still see and use/skip these data.

element.name: BlockMore
element.documentation: Contain the BlockAdditional and some parameters.

element.name: BlockAddID
element.documentation: An ID to identify the BlockAdditional level.

element.name: BlockAdditional
element.documentation: Interpreted by the codec as it wishes (using the BlockAddID).

element.name: BlockDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the Block (based on TimestampScale). This Element is mandatory when DefaultDuration is set for the track (but can be omitted as other default values). When not written and with no DefaultDuration, the value is assumed to be the difference between the timestamp of this Block and the timestamp of the next Block in "display" order (not coding order). This Element can be useful at the end of a Track (as there is no other Block available), or when there is a break in a track like for subtitle tracks.

element.name: ReferenceBlock
element.documentation: Timestamp of another frame used as a reference (ie: B or P frame). The timestamp is relative to the block it's attached to.

element.name: DiscardPadding
element.documentation: Duration in nanoseconds of the silent data added to the Block (padding at the end of the Block for positive value, at the beginning of the Block for negative value). The duration of DiscardPadding is not calculated in the duration of the TrackEntry and SHOULD be discarded during playback.

element.name: Tracks
element.documentation: A Top-Level Element of information with many tracks described.

element.name: TrackEntry
element.documentation: Describes a track with all Elements.

element.name: TrackNumber
element.documentation: The track number as used in the Block Header (using more than 127 tracks is not encouraged, though the design allows an unlimited number).

element.name: TrackUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Track. This SHOULD be kept the same when making a direct stream copy of the Track to another file.

element.name: TrackType
element.documentation: A set of track types coded on 8 bits.

element.name: FlagEnabled
element.documentation: Set if the track is usable. (1 bit)

element.name: FlagDefault
element.documentation: Set if that track (audio, video or subs) SHOULD be active if no language found matches the user preference. (1 bit)

element.name: FlagForced
element.documentation: Set if that track MUST be active during playback. There can be many forced track for a kind (audio, video or subs), the player SHOULD select the one which language matches the user preference or the default + forced track. Overlay MAY happen between a forced and non-forced track of the same kind. (1 bit)

element.name: FlagLacing
element.documentation: Set if the track MAY contain blocks using lacing. (1 bit)

element.name: DefaultDuration
element.documentation: Number of nanoseconds (not scaled via TimestampScale) per frame ('frame' in the Matroska sense -- one Element put into a (Simple)Block).

element.name: Name
element.documentation: A human-readable track name.

element.name: Language
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the track in the Matroska languages form. This Element MUST be ignored if the LanguageIETF Element is used in the same TrackEntry.

element.name: LanguageIETF
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the track according to BCP 47 and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry. If this Element is used, then any Language Elements used in the same TrackEntry MUST be ignored.

element.name: CodecID
element.documentation: An ID corresponding to the codec, see the codec page for more info.

element.name: CodecPrivate
element.documentation: Private data only known to the codec.

element.name: CodecName
element.documentation: A human-readable string specifying the codec.

element.name: CodecDelay
element.documentation: CodecDelay is The codec-built-in delay in nanoseconds. This value MUST be subtracted from each block timestamp in order to get the actual timestamp. The value SHOULD be small so the muxing of tracks with the same actual timestamp are in the same Cluster.

element.name: SeekPreRoll
element.documentation: After a discontinuity, SeekPreRoll is the duration in nanoseconds of the data the decoder MUST decode before the decoded data is valid.

element.name: Video
element.documentation: Video settings.

element.name: FlagInterlaced
element.documentation: A flag to declare if the video is known to be progressive or interlaced and if applicable to declare details about the interlacement.

element.name: StereoMode
element.documentation: Stereo-3D video mode. There are some more details on 3D support in the Specification Notes.

enum.label: both eyes laced in one Block (left eye is first)
both eyes laced in one Block (right eye is first)

element.name: AlphaMode
element.documentation: Alpha Video Mode. Presence of this Element indicates that the BlockAdditional Element could contain Alpha data.

element.name: PixelWidth
element.documentation: Width of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelHeight
element.documentation: Height of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelCropBottom
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the bottom of the image.

element.name: PixelCropTop
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the top of the image.

element.name: PixelCropLeft
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the left of the image.

element.name: PixelCropRight
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the right of the image.

element.name: DisplayWidth
element.documentation: Width of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements). The default value is only valid when DisplayUnit is 0.

element.name: DisplayHeight
element.documentation: Height of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements). The default value is only valid when DisplayUnit is 0.

element.name: DisplayUnit
element.documentation: How DisplayWidth & DisplayHeight are interpreted.

element.name: AspectRatioType
element.documentation: Specify the possible modifications to the aspect ratio.

element.name: Projection
element.documentation: Describes the video projection details. Used to render spherical and VR videos.

element.name: ProjectionType
element.documentation: Describes the projection used for this video track.

element.name: ProjectionPrivate
element.documentation:
Private data that only applies to a specific projection.
Semantics
If ProjectionType equals 0 (Rectangular), then this element must not be present.
If ProjectionType equals 1 (Equirectangular), then this element must be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Equirectangular Projection Box ('equi').
If ProjectionType equals 2 (Cubemap), then this element must be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Cubemap Projection Box ('cbmp').
If ProjectionType equals 3 (Mesh), then this element must be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Mesh Projection Box ('mshp').
Note: ISOBMFF box size and fourcc fields are not included in the binary data, but the FullBox version and flag fields are. This is to avoid redundant framing information while preserving versioning and semantics between the two container formats.

element.name: ProjectionPoseYaw
element.documentation:
Specifies a yaw rotation to the projection.
Semantics
Value represents a clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the up vector. This rotation must be applied before any ProjectionPosePitch or ProjectionPoseRoll rotations. The value of this field should be in the -180 to 180 degree range.

element.name: ProjectionPosePitch
element.documentation:
Specifies a pitch rotation to the projection.
Semantics
Value represents a counter-clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the right vector. This rotation must be applied after the ProjectionPoseYaw rotation and before the ProjectionPoseRoll rotation. The value of this field should be in the -90 to 90 degree range.

element.name: ProjectionPoseRoll
element.documentation:
Specifies a roll rotation to the projection.
Semantics
Value represents a counter-clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the forward vector. This rotation must be applied after the ProjectionPoseYaw and ProjectionPosePitch rotations. The value of this field should be in the -180 to 180 degree range.

element.name: Audio
element.documentation: Audio settings.

element.name: SamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Sampling frequency in Hz.

element.name: OutputSamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Real output sampling frequency in Hz (used for SBR techniques).

element.name: Channels
element.documentation: Numbers of channels in the track.

element.name: BitDepth
element.documentation: Bits per sample, mostly used for PCM.

element.name: ContentEncodings
element.documentation: Settings for several content encoding mechanisms like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncoding
element.documentation: Settings for one content encoding like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncodingOrder
element.documentation: Tells when this modification was used during encoding/muxing starting with 0 and counting upwards. The decoder/demuxer has to start with the highest order number it finds and work its way down. This value has to be unique over all ContentEncodingOrder Elements in the TrackEntry that contains this ContentEncodingOrder element.

element.name: ContentEncodingScope
element.documentation: A bit field that describes which Elements have been modified in this way. Values (big endian) can be OR'ed.

enum.label: All frame contents, excluding lacing data
The next ContentEncoding (next `ContentEncodingOrder`. Either the data inside `ContentCompression` and/or `ContentEncryption`)

element.name: ContentEncodingType
element.documentation: A value describing what kind of transformation is applied.

element.name: ContentEncryption
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption used. This Element MUST be present if the value of `ContentEncodingType` is 1 (encryption) and MUST be ignored otherwise.

element.name: ContentEncAlgo
element.documentation: The encryption algorithm used. The value '0' means that the contents have not been encrypted but only signed.

element.name: ContentEncKeyID
element.documentation: For public key algorithms this is the ID of the public key the the data was encrypted with.

element.name: ContentEncAESSettings
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption algorithm used. If `ContentEncAlgo` != 5 this MUST be ignored.

element.name: AESSettingsCipherMode
element.documentation: The AES cipher mode used in the encryption.

enum.label: AES-CBC / Cipher Block Chaining, NIST SP 800-38A

element.name: Cues
element.documentation: A Top-Level Element to speed seeking access. All entries are local to the Segment. This Element SHOULD be mandatory for non "live" streams.

element.name: CuePoint
element.documentation: Contains all information relative to a seek point in the Segment.

element.name: CueTime
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp according to the Segment time base.

element.name: CueTrackPositions
element.documentation: Contain positions for different tracks corresponding to the timestamp.

element.name: CueTrack
element.documentation: The track for which a position is given.

element.name: CueClusterPosition
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Cluster containing the associated Block.

element.name: CueRelativePosition
element.documentation: The relative position inside the Cluster of the referenced SimpleBlock or BlockGroup with 0 being the first possible position for an Element inside that Cluster.

element.name: CueDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the block according to the Segment time base. If missing the track's DefaultDuration does not apply and no duration information is available in terms of the cues.

element.name: CueBlockNumber
element.documentation: Number of the Block in the specified Cluster.

element.name: Chapters
element.documentation: A system to define basic menus and partition data. For more detailed information, look at the Chapters Explanation.

element.name: EditionEntry
element.documentation: Contains all information about a Segment edition.

element.name: ChapterAtom
element.documentation: Contains the atom information to use as the chapter atom (apply to all tracks).

element.name: ChapterUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Chapter.

element.name: ChapterStringUID
element.documentation: A unique string ID to identify the Chapter. Use for WebVTT cue identifier storage.

element.name: ChapterTimeStart
element.documentation: Timestamp of the start of Chapter (not scaled).

element.name: ChapterTimeEnd
element.documentation: Timestamp of the end of Chapter (timestamp excluded, not scaled).

element.name: ChapterDisplay
element.documentation: Contains all possible strings to use for the chapter display.

element.name: ChapString
element.documentation: Contains the string to use as the chapter atom.

element.name: ChapLanguage
element.documentation: The languages corresponding to the string, in the bibliographic ISO-639-2 form. This Element MUST be ignored if the ChapLanguageIETF Element is used within the same ChapterDisplay Element.

element.name: ChapCountry
element.documentation: The countries corresponding to the string, same 2 octets as in Internet domains. This Element MUST be ignored if the ChapLanguageIETF Element is used within the same ChapterDisplay Element.

element.name: Tags
element.documentation: Element containing metadata describing Tracks, Editions, Chapters, Attachments, or the Segment as a whole. A list of valid tags can be found here.

element.name: Tag
element.documentation: A single metadata descriptor.

element.name: Targets
element.documentation: Specifies which other elements the metadata represented by the Tag applies to. If empty or not present, then the Tag describes everything in the Segment.

element.name: TargetTypeValue
element.documentation: A number to indicate the logical level of the target.

enum.label: COLLECTION
enum.documentation: The highest hierarchical level that tags can describe.

enum.label: EDITION / ISSUE / VOLUME / OPUS / SEASON / SEQUEL
enum.documentation: A list of lower levels grouped together.

enum.label: ALBUM / OPERA / CONCERT / MOVIE / EPISODE / CONCERT
enum.documentation: The most common grouping level of music and video (equals to an episode for TV series).

enum.label: PART / SESSION
enum.documentation: When an album or episode has different logical parts.

enum.label: TRACK / SONG / CHAPTER
enum.documentation: The common parts of an album or movie.

enum.label: SUBTRACK / PART / MOVEMENT / SCENE
enum.documentation: Corresponds to parts of a track for audio (like a movement).

enum.label: SHOT
enum.documentation: The lowest hierarchy found in music or movies.

element.name: TargetType
element.documentation: An informational string that can be used to display the logical level of the target like "ALBUM", "TRACK", "MOVIE", "CHAPTER", etc (see TargetType).

element.name: TagTrackUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Track(s) the tags belong to. If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all tracks in the Segment.

element.name: SimpleTag
element.documentation: Contains general information about the target.

element.name: TagName
element.documentation: The name of the Tag that is going to be stored.

element.name: TagLanguage
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the tag specified, in the Matroska languages form. This Element MUST be ignored if the TagLanguageIETF Element is used within the same SimpleTag Element.

element.name: TagDefault
element.documentation: A boolean value to indicate if this is the default/original language to use for the given tag.

element.name: TagString
element.documentation: The value of the Tag.

element.name: TagBinary
element.documentation: The values of the Tag if it is binary. Note that this cannot be used in the same SimpleTag as TagString.
